sentence.text: Dysfunction of the cerebral glucose transporter GLUT1 (encoded by SLC2A1) is known to result in epilepsy, intellectual disability (ID), and movement disorder.

Using whole-exome sequencing, we identified rare homozygous missense variants (c.526CAAAAT [p.Arg176Trp] and c.629CAAAAT [p.Ala210Val]) in SLC45A1, encoding another cerebral glucose transporter, in two consanguineous multiplex families with moderate to severe ID, epilepsy, and variable neuropsychiatric features.
All together, our data strongly suggest that recessive mutations in SLC45A1 cause ID and epilepsy.
